event: Comet C/2022 E3 (ZTF) made its closest approach to Earth, observable in the night sky (2023)
The Solar and Heliospheric Observatory (SOHO) began its operational phase, sending back its first images of the Sun (1996)
Luna 9 achieved the first soft landing on the Moon (1966)
A total solar eclipse occurred, visible across parts of South America and Africa (1962)
Astronomers announced the discovery of 12 additional moons orbiting Jupiter (2023)
Discovery of the first pulsar by Jocelyn Bell Burnell and Antony Hewish (1967)
ESA's Rosetta spacecraft was launched to study comet 67P/Churyumovâ€“Gerasimenko (2004)
NASA's NEAR Shoemaker spacecraft entered orbit around asteroid 433 Eros (2000)
Launch of the Infrared Astronomical Satellite (IRAS), the first space telescope to survey the sky in infrared (1983)
The Soviet Union's Deep Space Station 13 received signals from the Mars 3 lander (1972)
Launch of NASA's Solar Dynamics Observatory to study solar activity (2010)
NEAR Shoemaker became the first spacecraft to land on an asteroid (433 Eros) (2001)
Venus reached its greatest brilliancy in the evening sky (2025)
NASA's Stardust mission successfully returned samples from comet Wild 2 to Earth (2006)
A meteor exploded over Chelyabinsk, Russia, causing widespread damage and injuries (2013)
Launch of the first set of Iridium satellites, beginning the formation of a global communication network (1998)
The first free flight of the Space Shuttle Enterprise during the Approach and Landing Tests (1977)
Discovery of Pluto by Clyde Tombaugh at the Lowell Observatory (1930)
A penumbral lunar eclipse was observed (1962)
John Glenn became the first American to orbit Earth aboard Friendship 7 (1962)
Launch of the Soviet Union's Mars 5 spacecraft to study Mars (1973)
Launch of the European Space Agency's Earth observation satellite Envisat (2002)
Supernova 1987A was observed in the Large Magellanic Cloud (1987)
Launch of the Space Shuttle Discovery on mission STS-63, the first shuttle flight with a female pilot (1995)
Launch of the Soviet Union's Venera 3 spacecraft (1965)
A total solar eclipse occurred (1998)
Confirmation of the first confirmed brown dwarf, Teide 1, in the Pleiades star cluster (1995)
Launch of the Rossi X-ray Timing Explorer to study time variability of cosmic X-ray sources (1996)
Galileo spacecraft made its closest flyby of Jupiter's moon Io (2000)
